| --- | --- |
| Localization Strategy | Mercedes-Benz follows a centralized localization strategy that is managed from its global headquarters in Stuttgart, Germany. |
| Teams | The localization team at Mercedes-Benz consists of project managers, translators, editors, and quality assurance specialists who work together to ensure the accuracy and consistency of translations. |
| TMS | Mercedes-Benz uses a Translation Management System (TMS) to manage translation workflows, maintain translation memories, and facilitate communication between team members. |
| MT | Machine Translation (MT) is not used for critical content, but it is used for non-critical content to increase efficiency and reduce costs. |
| TM | Mercedes-Benz uses Translation Memories (TM) to store and reuse previously translated content, which helps to improve consistency and reduce costs. |
| API | Mercedes-Benz has an API that allows for the integration of translation workflows with other systems, such as its content management system (CMS) and TMS. |
| CMS Integration | Mercedes-Benz uses a CMS to manage its web content and allows for integration with its TMS to streamline the localization process. |
| Security | Mercedes-Benz places a high priority on security and implements various security measures, such as encryption and access controls, to protect sensitive data. |
| Standards and Guidelines | Mercedes-Benz follows a set of internal localization standards and guidelines to ensure the quality and consistency of translations across all languages and content types. |
| I18N tools | Mercedes-Benz uses various Internationalization (I18N) tools to prepare content for localization and ensure that it is easily translatable. |
| Methods and Models | Mercedes-Benz uses various methods and models, such as agile and waterfall, to manage translation projects and ensure timely delivery of high-quality translations. |
| Workflows | Mercedes-Benz has well-defined translation workflows that are designed to ensure the accuracy and consistency of translations and facilitate collaboration between team members. |
| TMS Customization | Mercedes-Benz has customized its TMS to meet its specific localization needs and to streamline the translation process. |
| Technics | Mercedes-Benz uses various technological tools and platforms, such as cloud-based systems and computer-assisted translation tools, to support its localization efforts. |
| Reporting and Analytics | Mercedes-Benz tracks various metrics, such as translation volume and quality scores, to measure the success of its localization efforts and identify areas for improvement. |
| Vendors | Mercedes-Benz works with various translation vendors to ensure that it has access to the necessary language expertise and resources to support its localization needs. |
| Reviews/LQA | Mercedes-Benz conducts reviews and Linguistic Quality Assurance (LQA) checks to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and quality of translations. |
| Scalability | Mercedes-Benz's localization process is designed to be scalable and able to handle large volumes of content across multiple languages. |
| User Friendliness | Mercedes-Benz's localization process is designed to be user-friendly, with clear workflows and communication channels, to ensure that all team members can participate effectively. |
| Cost | Mercedes-Benz's localization process is designed to optimize costs while maintaining high quality and consistency of translations. |
| User/License Limits | Mercedes-Benz sets limits on the number of users and licenses to ensure that its localization resources are used effectively and efficiently. |
| Collaboration | Mercedes-Benz's localization process is designed to facilitate collaboration and communication between team members, vendors, and stakeholders to ensure that translations meet the necessary quality standards. |
